SELECT 
  id::text AS id,
  name,
  description,
  status::text,
  scope::text,
  success_criteria,
  due_date::text,
  project_id::text,
  parent_goal_id::text,
  created_at::text,
  updated_at::text,
  COALESCE(
    (SELECT ARRAY_AGG(t.id::text) 
     FROM tasks t 
     WHERE t.goal_id = g.id),

WHERE status <> 'Done'
  AND project_id = $1::uuid
ORDER BY created_at;

parameters.toolDescription: Create a new goal/milestone in the database. Use this after gathering milestone information from user. Returns the goal_id which you MUST save for later references. Keep milestones HIGH-LEVEL (coarse format) - no task elaboration.
Update any goal fields dynamically. Provide the goal_id and a raw SQL SET clause. The updated_at field is automatically updated by database trigger. Use this for any goal updates.
Delete a goal that is no longer relevant. Use this carefully as it will remove the goal from the database. Returns the deleted goal's details for confirmation.

parameters.query:
SELECT 
  g.id::text AS id,
  g.name,
  g.description,
  g.status::text,
  g.scope::text,
  g.success_criteria,
  g.due_date::text,
  g.project_id::text,
  g.parent_goal_id::text,
  g.created_at::text,
  g.updated_at::text,
  COALESCE(
    (SELECT ARRAY_AGG(t.id::text) 
     FROM tasks t 
     WHERE t.goal_id = g.id),
    ARRAY[]::text[]
  ) AS task_children,
  CASE 
    WHEN g.parent_goal_id IS NOT NULL THEN
      json_build_object(
        'id', pg.id::text,
        'name', pg.name,
        'description', pg.description,
        'status', pg.status::text,
        'scope', pg.scope::text,
        'success_criteria', pg.success_criteria,
        'due_date', pg.due_date::text,
        'project_id', pg.project_id::text,
        'created_at', pg.created_at::text,
        'updated_at', pg.updated_at::text
      )
    ELSE NULL
  END AS parent_goal_data
FROM goals g
LEFT JOIN goals pg ON g.parent_goal_id = pg.id
WHERE g.scope = 'Weekly-Milestone'
  AND g.status <> 'Done'
  AND g.project_id = $1::uuid
ORDER BY g.created_at;

     FROM task_dependencies td 
     WHERE td.task_id = t.id),
    ARRAY[]::text[]
  ) AS dependency_ids,
  t.created_at::text,
  t.updated_at::text
FROM tasks t
WHERE t.goal_id = '{{ $fromAI('goal_id', 'UUID of the goal to list tasks for', 'string') }}'
ORDER BY t.week_start_date, t.created_at;

parameters.toolDescription: Get full details of a specific task including all fields and dependencies.
parameters.query:
=SELECT 
  t.id::text,
  t.name,
  t.description,
  t.status::text,
  t.task_type::text,
  t.priority::text,
  t.effort_level::text,
  t.time_estimate_minutes,
  t.due_date::text,
  t.date_completed::text,
  t.week_start_date::text,
  t.goal_id::text,
  COALESCE(
    (SELECT ARRAY_AGG(td.depends_on_task_id::text) 
     FROM task_dependencies td 
     WHERE td.task_id = t.id),
    ARRAY[]::text[]
  ) AS dependency_ids,
  t.created_at::text,
  t.updated_at::text
FROM tasks t
WHERE t.id = '{{ $fromAI('task_id', 'UUID of the task to read', 'string') }}';

parameters.toolDescription: Create a new task with structured format (FR6). Returns task_id which you MUST save and use for dependencies. CRITICAL: You must provide ALL fields including task_type, priority, effort_level, and time_estimate_minutes - do not leave them empty or they will default to null. Required: name, description, goal_id. Strongly recommended: task_type, priority, effort_level, time_estimate_minutes (in MINUTES 60-480), week_start_date. Optional: due_date, assignee.

Update any task fields dynamically. Provide the task_id and a raw SQL SET clause. The updated_at field is automatically updated by database trigger. Use this for any task updates including status changes.
Delete a task that is no longer needed. Use this carefully as it will remove the task and its dependencies. Returns the deleted task's details for confirmation.
Add a dependency between tasks (task depends on another task). The database automatically prevents circular dependencies. Use this after creating tasks to establish execution order.
Remove a dependency between tasks. Use this when task execution order changes or dependencies are no longer valid.
parameters.query:
=DELETE FROM task_dependencies
WHERE task_id = '{{ $fromAI('task_id', 'UUID of the task that has the dependency', 'string') }}'
  AND depends_on_task_id = '{{ $fromAI('depends_on_task_id', 'UUID of the dependency to remove', 'string') }}'
RETURNING id::text, task_id::text, depends_on_task_id::text;

parameters.toolDescription: Link a knowledge base entry to a task. Use the knowledge_base_id from create KB response and task_id. This associates research/documents with specific tasks. You can link the same KB entry to multiple entities.
parameters.query:
=INSERT INTO knowledge_base_references (knowledge_base_id, entity_type, entity_id)
VALUES (
  '{{ $fromAI('knowledge_base_id', 'UUID of the knowledge base entry (from create KB response)', 'string') }}',
  'task',
  '{{ $fromAI('task_id', 'UUID of the task to link this knowledge to', 'string') }}'
)
RETURNING id, knowledge_base_id, entity_type, entity_id, created_at;

parameters.content:
# Query Data
### Query data from PostgreSQL. Get Projects that are Active or in Planning Phase

parameters.query:
SELECT 
  id::text AS "Project Id",
  name AS "Project Name",
  status::text AS "Status",
  description AS "Project Description",
  COALESCE(
    (SELECT ARRAY_AGG(g.id::text) 
     FROM goals g 
     WHERE g.project_id = p.id),
    ARRAY[]::text[]
  ) AS "Goal/Milestone Children",
  COALESCE(
    (SELECT ARRAY_AGG(t.id::text) 
     FROM tasks t 
     JOIN goals g ON t.goal_id = g.id 
     WHERE g.project_id = p.id),
    ARRAY[]::text[]
  ) AS "Task Children",
  time_estimate_months AS "Time Estimate (Months)",
  time_estimation_validated AS "Time Estimated Validated",
  is_validated AS "Project Validated",
  milestone_granularity::text AS "Milestone Granularity",
  expansion_horizon::text AS "Expansion Horizon",
  start_date::text AS "Start date",
  end_date::text AS "End date"
FROM projects p
WHERE status IN ('Planning Phase', 'Active')
ORDER BY created_at;

parameters.content:
# Event Horizon Master Router Agent
### This agent see's what projects exist and what state they're in and presents the options to the user to continue on a project or start a new one. It can also directly route the user if they make a clear unambiguous request.

# Project Validation Agent
### This agent helps you plan out projects by conducting research to validate the business idea, or to validate the time frame. A high level plan is created during this step. This agent passes you to the Goal Management Agent when you've establish your project and are ready to move forward

# Task Management Agent
### This agent helps the user break down the weekly milestones into actionable tasks to make progress towards the parent goal.

# Goal Management Agent
### This agent helps you establish month and quarterly goals, and weekly-milestones (which in turn get broken down into tasks by the next agnet). You can come back to this agent to modify your goals and milestones whenever you believe your plan needs to be modified.

## All Agents Mutual Tools
### Note: All Agents have access to Perplexity, and to save information to the knowledgebase

nodes.name: Combine Context with Goals and Tasks Data

parameters.toolDescription: Read all knowledge base entries linked to a specific entity (project, goal, or task). Use this to show the user what research and documentation has already been done for any entity in the system.
parameters.query:
=SELECT 
  kb.id,
  kb.document_name,
  kb.content,
  kb.ai_summary,
  kb.file_attachment,
  kb.link_citations,
  kb.date_added,
  kb.created_at,
  kb.updated_at,
  kbr.entity_type,
  kbr.entity_id
FROM knowledge_base kb
JOIN knowledge_base_references kbr ON kb.id = kbr.knowledge_base_id
  WHERE kbr.entity_id IN {{ $fromAI('entity_ids', "Array of entity UUIDs (projects, goals, or tasks) to read knowledge for. Provide as flatten sql list: ('uuid1', 'uuid2', 'uuid3')", 'string') }}
ORDER BY kb.date_added DESC, kb.created_at DESC;
